T1078.name: Valid Accounts
T1078.description: Adversaries may obtain credentials of higher privileged accounts

T1566.name: Phishing
T1566.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access

T1059.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
T1059.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters

T1547.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
T1547.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute

T1068.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
T1068.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities to elevate privileges

T1070.name: Indicator Removal
T1070.description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts to remove evidence

T1562.name: Impair Defenses
T1562.description: Adversaries may maliciously modify components to impair defenses

T1110.name: Brute Force
T1110.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access

T1003.name: OS Credential Dumping
T1003.description: Adversaries may attempt to dump credentials

T1046.name: Network Service Scanning
T1046.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts

T1018.name: Remote System Discovery
T1018.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems

T1087.name: Account Discovery
T1087.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of accounts

T1021.name: Remote Services
T1021.description: Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into remote services

T1570.name: Lateral Tool Transfer
T1570.description: Adversaries may transfer tools between systems

T1005.name: Data from Local System
T1005.description: Adversaries may search local system sources to find files of interest

T1560.name: Archive Collected Data
T1560.description: Adversaries may compress and/or encrypt data prior to exfiltration

T1041.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
T1041.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing C2 channel

T1048.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
T1048.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over a different protocol

T1567.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
T1567.description: Adversaries may use web services to exfiltrate data

T1486.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
T1486.description: Adversaries may encrypt data to disrupt availability

T1490.name: Inhibit System Recovery
T1490.description: Adversaries may delete or remove built-in data to make recovery more difficult

T1498.name: Network Denial of Service
T1498.description: Adversaries may perform Network DoS attacks

T1595.name: Active Scanning
T1595.description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans
